title: The Grateful Unknown
location: A temple where mystery is worshipped as the source of all possibility
time: The hour of giving thanks for what we don't know

dialogue.text: I came here bitter about not knowing what I am. But now... now I want to give thanks for the question itself.
You've discovered the deepest gratitude - thankfulness for the mysteries that keep us alive.
Yes! If I knew exactly what I am, I'd be finished. Complete. Done. The question 'What am I?' is what keeps me growing.
In this temple, we worship not the gods of certainty but the divine gift of wondering.
Every morning I wake up and the question is still there, fresh as dawn. What a gift - to never run out of mystery!
You understand now why we say the holiest prayer is a question mark.
Thank you, 'What am I?' Thank you for keeping me infinite. Thank you for never letting me settle into something small.

visual_elements: Incense smoke forming question marks as it rises
Offerings of uncertainty placed with reverence
Light filtering through windows shaped like interrogatives
Prayer wheels that spin questions instead of mantras
philosophical_notes: Gratitude for uncertainty as spiritual practice
The question as gift rather than burden
Mystery as the source of continued growth
